metrics_data.verboseLogs:
Truths (limit=None):
[
    "The World Health Organization published a document titled "Guideline for the prevention, diagnosis and treatment of infertility" covering infertility prevalence estimates from 1990 to 2021, released in Geneva in 2023.",
    "The WHO's "The selection and use of essential medicines 2023: web annex A: World Health Organization model list of essential medicines: 23rd list (2023)" was published in Geneva in 2023 and is available at https://iris.who.int/handle/10665/371090.",
    "The WHO's "The selection and use of essential in vitro diagnostics: report of the fourth meeting of the WHO Strategic Advisory Group of Experts on In Vitro Diagnostics, 2022 (including the fourth WHO model list of essential in vitro diagnostics)" was published in Geneva in 2023 and is available at https://iris.who.int/handle/10665/373322.",
    "Mburu G, Kiarie J, and Allotey P authored the article "Towards a nuanced view and response to global fertility trends" published in The Lancet in 2024, volume 403, issue 10440, pages 1953-56, with DOI https://doi.org/10.1016/s0140-6736(24)00490-2.",
    "Chapter 12 of the WHO guideline is titled "Research gaps, future scope and updating the guideline".",
    "Figure 12.1 in the guideline is titled "The need to address critical research gaps" and appears on page .204.",
    "Figure 12.2 in the guideline is titled "Future guideline scope and updates" and appears on page .205.",
    "Figure A1.1 in the guideline is titled "Causes of infertility" and appears on page .208.",
    "Figure A1.2 in the guideline is titled "Specific diagnoses of infertility (male)" and appears on page .210."
] 
 
Claims:
[
    "The WHO Guideline for the prevention, diagnosis and treatment of infertility is organized around three core components — Prevention, Diagnosis, and Treatment (9789240115774‑eng.pdf).",
    "The male diagnostic protocols are presented within the Diagnosis component, in the subsection that deals specifically with the evaluation of male infertility (e.g., comprehensive male infertility assessment) (9789240115774‑eng.pdf)."
] 
 
Verdicts:
[
    {
        "verdict": "idk",
        "reason": "The retrieval context mentions the WHO guideline title and some chapter and figure details, but it does not provide any information about the guideline being organized around three core components (Prevention, Diagnosis, Treatment). Therefore, the claim cannot be confirmed nor contradicted by the given context."
    },
    {
        "verdict": "idk",
        "reason": "The context lists figures and chapters of the WHO guideline but does not describe the placement of male diagnostic protocols within a specific Diagnosis subsection. Hence, there is no evidence in the provided context to verify or refute the claim."
    }
]

metrics_data.name: Contextual Precision
metrics_data.reason: The score is 0.58 because the first node (rank 1) is irrelevant – it only contains the title and lacks any component names or male diagnostic details, as noted in the reason "The text only contains the title *\"Guideline for the prevention, diagnosis and treatment of infertility\"* and does not provide any of the WHO guideline component names or mention the section on male diagnostic protocols." This irrelevant node being ranked above the relevant ones drags the precision down. The next two nodes (ranks 2 and 3) are relevant – one cites "Chapter 12 Research gaps, future scope and updating the guideline" linking to a guideline component, and the other includes the figure caption "Fig. A1.2. Specific diagnoses of infertility (male)" directly tied to male diagnostic protocols. Their presence improves the score, but the early irrelevant ranking prevents a higher precision.

test_results.input: Enumerate WHO infertility guideline components and specify which section addresses male diagnostic protocols.
test_results.actual_output:
The WHO Guideline for the prevention, diagnosis and treatment of infertility is organized around three core components — **Prevention**, **Diagnosis**, and **Treatment**【0】(9789240115774‑eng.pdf).  

The **male diagnostic protocols** are presented within the **Diagnosis** component, in the subsection that deals specifically with the evaluation of male infertility (e.g., comprehensive male infertility assessment)【2】(9789240115774‑eng.pdf).
test_results.expected_output:
**WHO infertility guideline components**

1. Executive summary  
2. Introduction  
3. Rationale & methodology  
4. Approach & management  
5. Prevention  
6. Diagnosis  
7. Treatment  
8. Dissemination  
9. Research gaps  
10. References  

**Section covering male diagnostic protocols**  
The **Diagnosis** section (see Reference 5: *WHO manual for the standardized investigation and diagnosis of the infertile male*) details the protocols for evaluating the infertile male.

retrieval_context: Guideline for the prevention, diagnosis and treatment of infertility

1. Infertility prevalence estimates: 1990-2021. Geneva: World Health Organization; 2023 (https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/366700). 2. The selection and use of essential medicines 2023: web annex A: World Health Organization model list of essential medicines: 23rd list (2023). Geneva: World Health Organization; 2023 (https://iris.who.int/handle/10665/371090). 3. The selection and use of essential in vitro diagnostics: report of the fourth meeting of the WHO Strategic Advisory Group of Experts on In Vitro Diagnostics, 2022 (including the fourth WHO model list of essential in vitro diagnostics). Geneva: World Health Organization; 2023 (https://iris.who.int/handle/10665/373322). 4. Mburu G, Kiarie J, Allotey P. Towards a nuanced view and response to global fertility trends. Lancet. 2024;403(10440):1953-56 ( https://doi. org/10.1016/s0140-6736(24)00490-2). <!-- image --> ## Chapter ## 12 Research gaps, future scope and updating the guideline
